description: net: change listener variable name from l to ln

messages.text:
yikes! will abandon.

On Wed, May 30, 2012 at 1:31 AM, Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org> wrote:
> On Tue, May 29, 2012 at 12:25 PM, Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:
>> I think it's because l looks like 1 in many fonts.  I know that's why I
>> write ln in my own code.
>
> We should remove l from the definition of letter in the Go spec then.
>
> Russ

Why?

This is just making code longer, and it's churn.
If we need to standardize, let's get rid of the n, not add it.
It's c for Conn and f for File, not cn and fe.

Russ

I think it's because l looks like 1 in many fonts.  I know that's why I
write ln in my own code.

On Tue, May 29, 2012 at 9:24 AM, Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org> wrote:

> Why?
>
> This is just making code longer, and it's churn.
> If we need to standardize, let's get rid of the n, not add it.
> It's c for Conn and f for File, not cn and fe.
>
> Russ
>

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

On Tue, May 29, 2012 at 12:25 PM, Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:
> I think it's because l looks like 1 in many fonts.  I know that's why I
> write ln in my own code.

We should remove l from the definition of letter in the Go spec then.

Russ

On Tue, May 29, 2012 at 12:25 PM, Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:
> I think it's because l looks like 1 in many fonts.  I know that's why I
> write ln in my own code.

I understand that, but that just means you need a better font, or else
that you accept the ambiguity (which is slight: you can't name a
variable 1, and a local variable named capital I would not be very
idiomatic Go, especially for a Listener). I don't think we need to
make an exception for this case. Are people actually filing bugs
saying they're confused because the receiver looks like a 1?

Russ

subject: code review 6257062: net: change listener variable name from l to ln
